summary: Doesnt find my printer although installed

description: This is really a Windows application, as the description says. But it runs fine under WINE on Ubuntu . Nothing extra needs to be done - just install this small snap and go. It has all the usual reader options.
summary: Works with all files on Ubuntu

description: Sumatra PDF has been my go to for years, ever since my Windows days. It's one of those rare programs that does what it says/need to & nothing more. Yes, I know there are other pdf readers written specifically for Linux, but I was ecstatic to find an old friend on Snap. Have used it on a Mint Mate machine for some time now with absolutely no hiccups.

Unquestionably the best ebook reader out there. Only shame is that it's windows exclusive so it can't be used on Linux. Maybe that's why it's the best ebook reader in the first place, who knows? About the only thing it's missing is an ability to annote epub files.

When I was using MS Windows, this app was my favorite viewer for PDF and ePub documents. Under Linux, however, it can access only the Home partition. Unfortunately, I have several other hard drive partions, and I keep PDFs on those.
summary: Can Access Only the HOME Partition

description: I love this compact yet powerful pdf reader. But unfortunately, with many files opened as tabs, it becomes impossible for some to be selected: the file does not show when one clicks on the specific tab.
summary: Best PDF reader on windows, but with flaws on Ubuntu

description: imposible navegar a directorios de ubuntu, tiene enlaces a "mi pc". a los del producto desarrolladores: mi pc no existe en los sistemas linux.
